page.title: 12Daresbury Laboratory
page.content: They were built here as it provided solid foundations on the sandstone rock in 1964 with the 120ft Tower added in 1974. It is all run by SERC and costs about Â£30m each year, the average wage is Â£13,000. The tower contains a 22m volt Tandem Van Der Graaff Generator used by research establishments. It is used for studies on the neucleus of the atom in medecine, engineering, archaeology, nuclear science and the origins of the universe. The centre is in operation all day and every day except for maintenance checks. There is an automatic cut off system. The local people think the lab. is dangerous but are being constantly reassured. At the base of the tower stands the computer room to control the larger experiments and 150 smaller ones scattered around the site.
